text: Haabefuld[1],[2] Utility Box (theHUB), collection analysis tools composed functions, scripts, electronic notebooks, worked examples. theHUB share tools MSU community improve analyses student outcomes, student success, survey responses. standard set processes methods along defined lexicon enables reproducibility, reduces time needed complete analysis-based projects, allows quick addition new methods encouraging data exploration. desire theHUB’s functionality grow time, others MSU contribute new features methods MSU community. Developed implemented R – open-source application robust community (campus around world) – theHUB removes need software license providing access myriad statistical analysis graphing options. theHUB’s documentation allows anyone use understand tools. Initially, theHUB contain three Learning Analytics v2.0 projects: survey analysis package presented 2021 Spring Conference, Survey Connections, along Semester Analysis Aiding/Assisting Students Unified Student Success Outcomes Analysis Reports applications. Currently, Semester Analysis Aiding/Assisting Students Unified Student Success Outcomes Analysis Reports applications hiatus due pivot theHUB’s focus. expect theHUB grow add new, yet conceived, ideas analysis methods literature, conversations others around campus, conferences seminars. Advanced Candidate Evaluation (ACE): Analyze summarize evaluations candidates positions. standardized interview candidate evaluation instrument containing collection questions can augmented include position-specific questions. result set bespoke reports; individual report candidate along comparative executive summary comparing candidates. option include breakdown evaluators’ MAUs job titles developed. NB: comments confidential search committee never access original Qualtrics data. Survey Connections: Analyze survey responses gain better understanding relationships responses respondents. Traditionally, survey analysis returns collection response counts comment summaries without considering important insightful relationships questions responses. Survey Connections package provides workflows cleaning survey data performing Likert Likert-like, multi-response, comment (text) analyses. package’s goal easily allow discovery relationships responses creation cohorts exploration analysis. See 2021 Spring Conference presentation demonstrating abilities.

MSU peers dataset also includes following columns aid construction subsets BigTen.tf: BigTen institution PAC12.tf: PAC-12 institution MAC.tf: MAC institution Public.tf: Public institution Landgrant.tf: Landgrant institution (based List land-grant universities Wikipedia entry) AAU.tf: Association American Universities (based AAU provided list) MIinsts.tf: Institutions within state Michigan OIOI.tf: institutions interest MSUpeer.tf: MSU peer institution selection WMU peer institutions used 2015 Carnegie Classification categories: Control: Public Level: Four-year Basic Classification: Doctoral universities, higher research activity Undergraduate Instructional Program: Professions plus arts & sciences, high graduate coexistence Graduate Instructional Program: Research doctoral, comprehensive programs, medical/veterinary school Enrollment Profile: High undergraduate Undergraduate Profile: Four-year, full-time, selective, higher transfer-Size Setting: Four-year, large, primarily residential Total enrollment; total research expenditures; total doctoral degrees awarded WMU peer instititions: Ball State University (Muncie, ) East Carolina University (Greenville, NC) Kent State University Kent (Kent, OH) Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) Northern Illinois University (Dekalb, IL) Ohio University - Main Campus (Athens, OH) Oklahoma State University - Main Campus (Stillwater, OK) Portland State University (Portland, ) SUNY Binghamton (Vestal, NY) University Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) University Memphis (Memphis, TN) University Nevada - Las Vegas (Las Vegas, NV) University North Carolina Greensboro (Greensboro, NC) University North Dakota (Grand Forks, ND) University Southern Mississippi (Hattiesburg, MS)

what: Collection of Learning Analytics tools to evaluate surveys, student outcomes, and student success. — theHUB-package
title: Collection of Learning Analytics tools to evaluate surveys, student outcomes, and student success. — theHUB-package
text: Hub Utility Box (theHUB; recursive backronym) collection analysis tools composed functions, scripts, electronic notebooks, worked examples. Sharing tools MSU community improves analyses student outcomes, student success, survey responses. standard set processes methods along defined lexicon enables reproducibility, reduces time needed complete analysis-based projects, allows quick addition new methods encouraging data exploration. desire theHUB’s functionality grow time, others MSU contribute new features methods community. Developed implemented R -- open-source application robust community (campus around world) -- theHUB removes need software license providing access myriad statistical analysis graphing options. documentation allows anyone use understand tools. theHUB contain Hub's LA v2.0 projects; currently survey analysis package, Survey Connections. Survey Connections: Traditionally, survey analysis returns collection response counts comment summaries without considering important insightful relationships questions responses. Survey Connections package provides workflows cleaning survey data performing Likert Likert-like, multi-response, comment analyses. package’s goal easily allow discovery relationships responses creation cohorts exploration analysis. Analyze survey responses gain better understanding relationships responses respondents.
